posts.post_content:
An absolutely fantastic card, in my opinion. As everyone has already stated, this has a high chance of quickly becoming an EDH frequent. An 8/8 vigilant flyer for 8 is something that will already have heads turnin' and haters hatin', but the added static-and-always-prevalent ability just adds the "thud" that every mythic deserves. I could go on and on about [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=236473) this and [Herald of War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Herald of War) that, but I think we already understand the obvious. If you're unlucky enough to be on the receiving end of Avacyn's spear, ready [all](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=240180) [appropriate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=157394) [wipes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=81991)!  
  
The art is simply astonishing, and Jason Chan has done an exemplary job of showing the return of a force to be reckoned with. The light and dark values coupled with a dynamic and commanding posture create a vivid representation of Sorin's legacy. Line, shape, and ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Paleopaladin: There's still mass -X/-X effects. My zombie deck, for example, could sac its army (including a [Noxious Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noxious Ghoul)) and bring it back with [Balthor the Defiled](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balthor the Defiled) to give all your creatures -8/-8 or more, killing Avacyn, Sigarda, Melira, Platinum, and Pristine. Late-game, Mutilate works too.  
  
Plus [Upheaval](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Upheaval), [Evacuation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evacuation), [Inundate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inundate), and [Wash Out](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wash Out) (White) still screw up your plans. Especially with a Warped Devotion in play.  
  
Also, [Hallowed Burial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hallowed Burial) and [Final Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Judgment).
posts.html:
Paleopaladin: There's still mass -X/-X effects. My zombie deck, for example, could sac its army (including a Noxious Ghoul) and bring it back with Balthor the Defiled to give all your creatures -8/-8 or more, killing Avacyn, Sigarda, Melira, Platinum, and Pristine. Late-game, Mutilate works too.

Plus Upheaval, Evacuation, Inundate, and Wash Out (White) still screw up your plans. Especially with a Warped Devotion in play.

Also, Hallowed Burial and Final Judgment.

posts.post_content: @Tsuichoi No, she wasn't. No hints suggested anything of the sort. Sorin is very B/W--the moral reason and balance are one and the same. He used to be human, remember, and he only became a vampire because Edgar decided to make him one on a whim. Avacyn is very holy--why else would she be "Avacyn, Angel of **Hope**"? No one knows exactly how she was created, and there's no reason to insult anyone else's deck. Or their intelligence. Seriously.

posts.post_content: @Heartbreakerstudios: Every color has a relatively easy way around this. White can exile her. Black can force her to be sacrificed, or give her zero toughness. Blue can bounce her. Green can just trample over her. And red can just burn her controller. If you play with any of these colors, you should already have these effects easily available.

posts.post_content:
Innistrad was already packed with incredibly powerful cards.  
  
[Army of the Damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Army of the Damned) also costs {8} and spots 13 2/2 black Zombies with Flashback.  
  
[Ghoultree](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghoultree) is a 10/10 Zombie Treefolk and also costs {8}, but can become cheaper and even free with enough creatures in the grave.  
  
[Bloodline Keeper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodline Keeper) costs only {4}, and is now easily the best thing for Tribal Vampire decks which already hurt like a \*\*\*.  
  
[Howlpack Alpha](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howlpack Alpha) costs ONLY {2} and yet pulls TRIPLE mass Tribal buffs, AND can spawn 2/2s each turn which benefit for a whole new Tribal deck. That's INSANE.  
  
And yet NONE of those come anywhere near the level of difficulty that Avacyn imposes on the game.  
  
A 6/6 Vigilant Flyer for {8} is par, and making it Angel is a nice Tribal bonus, but it needs a little bit more to make it stand out.  
  
Holy crap! The new [Gisela, Blade of Goldnight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gisela, Blade of Goldnight) is a 5/5 Firststriking Flyer Angel for {7} with the UNC... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Innistrad was already packed with incredibly powerful cards.

Army of the Damned also costs {8} and spots 13 2/2 black Zombies with Flashback.

Ghoultree is a 10/10 Zombie Treefolk and also costs {8}, but can become cheaper and even free with enough creatures in the grave.

Bloodline Keeper costs only {4}, and is now easily the best thing for Tribal Vampire decks which already hurt like a ***.

Howlpack Alpha costs ONLY {2} and yet pulls TRIPLE mass Tribal buffs, AND can spawn 2/2s each turn which benefit for a whole new Tribal deck. That's INSANE.

And yet NONE of those come anywhere near the level of difficulty that Avacyn imposes on the game.

A 6/6 Vigilant Flyer for {8} is par, and making it Angel is a nice Tribal bonus, but it needs a little bit more to make it stand out.
